title: [BEAM-5852][SQL] Disallow checked exceptions in UDF
body:
Bad things happen when you have UDFs that throw checked exceptions, so don't allow it. (It also breaks the compiler with #6417.)

------------------------

title: [BEAM-6096] illegal signature attribute when compiling with JDK 11
body:
This change fixes a compilation error with JDK 11:

```
error: error while generating class <anonymous org.apache.beam.fn.harness.WindowMergingFnRunner$MergingViaWindowFnRunner$1>
(illegal signature attribute for type CAP#1)
where CAP#1 is a fresh type-variable:
CAP#1 extends Object from capture of ?
```

The code was previously accepted by javac due to a bug, which has been fixed in JDK 11: https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8203436

------------------------

title: [BEAM-6084] Fix Dataflow runner task dependencies for container registration.
body:
PR #6993 introduced automatic cleanup of container images pushed to
a container registry. However the logic requires all tasks which use the
container registry to declare an explicit dependency, otherwise the
cleanup can run before the consuming task completes.

This change adds explicit dependencies where needed as well as
documentation for this requirement.

title: Don't redundantly execute pre-commits as part of Jenkins post-commits
body:
Each post-commit suite is configured to also include pre-commit tests. However, in Jenkins we run pre-commits separately from post-commits, and in all cases when a language post-commit suite runs, the pre-commit is also run separate (in PR, on merge, cron schedule). So, it makes sense to separate the targets. This will free up resources and give a faster signal on post-commit suites as they are doing less work.

Based on data from this PR, here's how the post-commit timings from compare to recent runs against master:

* [Python](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Python_Verify_PR/254/): 52 mins, down from [~80 mins](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Python_Verify/buildTimeTrend), **35% reduction**
* [Go](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_GradleBuild_PR/35/): 11 mins, down from [~13 mins](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_GradleBuild/buildTimeTrend), **15% reduction**
* [Java](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_GradleBuild_PR/218/): 102 mins, down from [~115 mins](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_GradleBuild/buildTimeTrend), **11% reduction**

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

title: [BEAM-6083] share parsing functions to parse time among SQL tests
body:
Sharing time parsing functions among SQL tests. 

The benefits are:
1. `new Datetime()` way looks too long in IDE and makes code hard to read.
2. In tests, if data is written into query (e.g. `"SELECT DATE '2018-01-30'"`), then that string can be copied to parsing functions for query result match (compared to write a `new Datetime`.
3. Reduce confusion of with/without timezone when creating a new Joda Datetime. 
4. Well formatted datetime string is more readable.
------------------------

title: [BEAM-6076] Fetch only required fields for BigQuery Table
body:
Before this change, all table fields were fetched which caused a
NullPointerException in StandardTableDefinition.java class -
the specific reason is that StreamingBuffer's "estimatedRows"
field is sometimes null. This change makes the client to skip fetching
this field so that it doesn't use the erroneous code.

title: [BEAM-6078] Use builder's keyspace by default when using CassandraIO.
body:
read()

Currently for CassandraIO.read(), it connects to the cluster without using the keyspace specified in the builder. (For writes it already does this).

This will allow to not specify the keyspace in the mapped object (it can be useful if the object is used in more than one keyspace).

title: [BEAM-5191] Support for BigQuery clustering
body:
Implemented BigQuery clustering: https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/clustered-tables.

As this is related to BigQuery TimePartitioning, I based my implementation on this commit:
https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/b0e03a33cf0c2c573a2d34d88506e19ebb28c934

As far as I know, there are no integration tests covering time partitioning, so I did not add tests for clustering. If needed I can write some if someone points me in the right direction.

This is my first feature PR, so I'm eager to get some proper feedback.
@jkff, @reuvenlax as you committed & authored time partitioning, can you have a look?

Thanks,
Wout

title: [BEAM-6063] KafkaIO: add writing support with ProducerRecord
body:
Added new transform `WriteRecords` based on Kafka `ProducerRecord`. API of old `Write` transform is kept as it was before but now it uses `WriteRecords` under the hood to write data. All internal functionality, which is not visible for user, has been changed to use `ProducerRecord` instead of `KV`.

title: [BEAM-4850] Remove some dependencies of apitools
body:
Remove dependency of `google-apitools` that is used to stage files to GCS. Instead, use latest google cloud storage library [`google-cloud-storage`](https://pypi.org/project/google-cloud-storage/).

[BEAM-4850](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-4850) explains why we want to move off from `google-apitools`.

title: [BEAM-5959] Reimplement GCS copies with rewrites.
body:
This allows for:
- Copying when storage classes and locations differ.
- Copying of larger files (multi-part calls).
- Copying to a bucket with a default customer managed encryption key
(CMEK).

Performance testing: done on internal Dataflow tests. Rename performance has not significantly changed: 149 rename/s vs 135 rename/s average with this PR.
(Renames are implemented as copy+delete.)

Also adds integration tests for copy and copy_batch.

------------------------

title: [BEAM-6049] Add option to load job to GCS in Dataflow Runner

Support an option "uploadGraph" which will load the Job object to the user's staging directory, remove the embedded graph before submission, and retrieve the graph from within the service.  This allows the DataflowRunner to support significantly larger job definitions.

title: [BEAM-5683] Add retry in pip download
body:
`pip download` sometimes failed due to PyPI backend flaky. We saw many instances happened in integration tests which makes PostCommit job flaky. We can add retry to make it more reliable.

- Add retry to pip download if the call exit with non-zero code.
- Redirect pip error to stdout which help people debugging if command failed after few retries.

+R: @pabloem @angoenka 

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.

title: [BEAM-5813] wait for the refresh of ES indices in all test utils that do index writes.
body:
Testsplit is flaky at least on ES6. From time to time, the expected number of splits is higher that the actual number of sources after the split. But both expected and actual number of splits are determined using `Math.ceil(indexSize/desiredBundleSize)`. My guess is that the difference is due to `indexSize` not being the same between the time when expected value is calculated and the time when it is actually estimated in split. This can have 2 reasons:
1- index size in ES has a part of random (says Elastic dev team)
2- refresh of the index was not finished when split is done.
=> This PR addresses point 2 because there is nothing we can do about point 1: test util requests to ES are issued **synchronously** and they specify `refresh=true` which causes a refresh to be done but I'm not sure that this refresh is synchronous. Instead use `refresh=wait` so that the request waits for the index refresh before returning.

R: @timrobertson100 
CC: @kennknowles

title: [BEAM-6011] Phrase triggering nexmark
body:
This PR enables running Nexmark jobs from PRs using Phrase Triggering. 

Phrase triggered Jobs: 
 - run exactly the same option sets as the PostCommit ones
 - have separate jenkins jobs definitions
 - publish results to "nexmark_PRs" dataset whereas the original jobs use "nexmark" dataset. Thanks to that there is no "data pollution"

Additionally, I created a special "Nexmark Builder" that encapsulates all tasks common to Nexmark. 

Despite the fact that I checked if the jobs run as they should, I didn't want to touch original jobs code yet give everyone time to spot any differences between the jobs (original/phrase triggered) if they occur. This can be easily done later in a separate PR by replacing the gradle goals code from origial jobs with the following line (example for direct runner): 

```
Nexmark.standardJob(delegate, Nexmark.Runner.DIRECT, JOB_SPECIFIC_OPTIONS, Nexmark.TriggeringContext.POST_COMMIT)
```
If you think this should be done now, let me know.


------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.

title: [BEAM-5788] Update storage_v1 client and messages
body:
Update storage_v1_client.py and storage_v1_messages.py. New files are auto-generated based on google-apitools 0.5.23 which is the minimum version Beam currently required. 

There are two places not updated:
- Apache License
- imports

This update will make storage_v1 API supports Python 3.

title: [BEAM-6159] Migrate dataflow portable worker using shared library to process bundle
body:
This is the PR in order to construct ExecutableStage and make dataflow protable batch worker use RemoteBundle to process bundle. There is an assumption in current implementation: there is only one input PCollection going to the ExecutableStage and all output PCollections will go to all following output receivers.

There will be a few following PRs:
1. Map output PCollection to following OutputReceivers.
2. Setup the gradle test task to track the new bundle processing  with ExecutableStage. 
3. Turn on the experiment path for streaming worker. 

R: @lukecwik 
cc: @huygaa11 @rohdesamuel

title: [BEAM-5964] Add ClickHouseIO.Write
body:
[ClickHouse](https://clickhouse.yandex) is open-source columnar DBMS for OLAP. It allows analysis of data that is updated in real time. The project was released as open-source software under the Apache 2 license in June 2016.

See [BEAM-5964](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-5964) for more details.

Features that are missing (to be added to JIRA):

- [x] java doc with examples and polish public API
- [x] add example (and test) for writing POJO-based PCollections
- [ ] integration tests for writing into `Distributed` tables
- [ ] integration tests and examples for writing unbounded PCollections
- [ ] reading in `ClickHouseIO.Read`
- [ ] validate that input schema is compatible with table schema (see Cast PTransform)
- [ ] support for `Enum8` and `Enum16` data types
- [ ] support for `Decimal` data type
- [ ] support for `UUID` data type
- [ ] support for experimental `LowCardinality(String)` data type


------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

title: [BEAM-3612] Add a shim generator tool
body:
Adds a type assertion shim generation tool, akin to specialize.

In particular it takes in a list of identifiers and go files from a single package and generates specialized type assertion shims for the given identifiers, using static analysis on the package code to 

A subsequent PR will do the work of adding the appropriate // go:generate tags to relevant beam provided DoFns to improve the performance of these.

A user could use the tool themselves with build tools like https://bazel.build or gradle with an appropriate invocation file, and avoid committing the generated files to their own repos, but have them when building with the tool. This doesn't help users who`go get` the beam packages though so we're best checking these into the beam repo.

------------------------

title: Heap-based global top.
body:
This adds a specialized implementation for global top that greatly reduces
the number of compares required in the (single) reducer.
Also uses heapq rather than repeated buffer + sort + truncate.

The new implementation doesn't accept side keywords and arguments, but these
(if any) are much more efficiently passed via a closure of the comparison
operator than on processing every single element.
